reviews_data.review_text: Spacious. Friendly service. Boutique coffee prices
Overall good experience. A bit pricey for the sandwich. The Hot chocolate was average.
Would be great if they had single origin's on bar but great space and coffee nonetheless.
Great, more on expensive side.
Pretty solid coffee shop. It's part of a local chain in south carolina so it's at least state-local. :) Really nice people, great vibe and music, and latte. It's in a cute little area too.
Love the seasonal coffee flavors!
As someone who doesn't drink coffee, I absolutely love this place! The teas are amazing! Hot chocolate is amazing! Everything is amazing!
Great selection (especially for us tea drinkers üôÇ), delicious, excellent vibe, indoor and outdoor seating

I love the option to sit inside or outside with the closed in patio. I ordered a cappuccino with oat and it was very tasty. A nice strong flavor, not too bitter. They offer food when I try it will update my review about it.  Beware of the parking, it on the smaller size. So time your visit. üòâ
Absolutely delicious! I have the avocado toast with the caramel latte and it was so delightful. I even have to get a second latte because of how good it was.
The best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. The bacon and egg biscuit has honey and sea salt drizzled on top. It's amazing.
Very good breakfast. Would come here again. Thanks.
Favorite local coffee spot!
Great study atmosphere and coffee.
Great vibe and like to have meetings here. Coffee is great
amazing drinks across the board and super inclusive environment! i love the neon they have as well!
Lovely spot! My iced latte and quiche were spectacular. All staff were friendly. Highly recommend!

What place is perfect? This one!! Great atmosphere, friendly and helpful service, one of the best cappuccinos I've ever had and clean bathrooms (you gotta have that!!). Just an overall excellent experience. üëåüèø
Best F'n coffee I ever had!

I jumped into the place at 17:01 and they refused to sell a Coffee. I got it the close time is 17:00 but come on I be inside at 1701 it's more actitud than other thing ‚Ä¶and  it's a Coffee store‚Ä¶ at the Coffee and te time star at 17:00‚Ä¶
Amazing place!! Always get greeted by the awesome people that work here. Very well managed, Kudos to this team :)
Visiting Charlotte and have been here twice in one week! One of the best iced lattes I've ever had and the chocolate chip scone was perfect. Nice outdoor patio too!
Perfect Saturday to start with ‚ÄúNOT JUST COFFEE‚Äù coffee üòÅ
Exceptionally good! I tried a latte with mocha and almond milk
The most delicious coffee I have had in awhile. I had an iced latte and it was spectacular!
Great coffee at park road. The employees are quite rude though.
This location is awesome and has amazing choices for coffee and food. I'm always impressed with whatever I feel like eating or drinking and the staff here is awesome!
Good food and coffee, not a fan of listening out for your name to get your meal. My meal was done as take out when I was dining in.
Uniquely refreshing
I just had the best avocado toast ever! The employees were super nice and I loved the atmosphere. I recommend adding egg to the toast. It was delicious!!!!!
Great employee art! Tasty coffee and yummy cookies!
Nothing terrible, just overpriced and loud. Wouldn't recommend.
Loved their avocado toast and the perfect place to have a coffee and get some work done.

NOT JUST COFFEE/ 222 S. Church street, Charlotte, NC. WOW! 1st time. Avocado toast - sourdough bread, garnished with sun dried tomatoes , pickles onions, slices of avocado. and Ricotta with jam. Creamy and fresh. PRESENTATION: very nice. Great. TASTE: amazing on both. Regret not getting 2 of each. DRINKS: vanilla iced  latte- very good too. STAFF: 2 young men very nice, polite, professional and cute too. Facility: clean, nice decor . Highly recommend it. Thanks Miami
Workers make up hours not to serve you. Call ahead, posted hours are not true hours.
Excellent selection of micro-brew coffee
Huge fan - the atmosphere is perfect and they're serving up more classic coffee choices, like Italian macchiato. Feels all very fresh ground and all great tasting choices.
One of the best coffee shops in Charlotte . Cappuccino is amazing . The stuff is really friendly .
Avocado toast was the best I've had so far!!!
Very cool little coffee shop! Got a delicious Caramel latte and oatmeal cookie, can't wait to visit Charlotte again and stop in!
Quaint and charming. A little pricey but good.
Great coffee, responsible and ethical sourcing.  Friendly staff and great feel to the business.

My friend and I came here excited to try a new place and everyone was glaring at us like we didn't belong. My friend said one of the staff members was rude to her. We honestly didn't know if we were doing anything wrong, we had our masks on, properly dressed, and were polite but less than 10 min after we were given our drinks we left ASAP because we didn't feel comfortable or safe at all.  The drinks are not bad but never again will I come back to a place where the staff and other customers will make us feel unwelcome or unsafe. üòû

the staff was friendly and the location was nice, prices weren't to crazy, however it took approx. 18 minutes to get us 3 hot chocolates and a tea and no there was no crazy long line.  the hot chocolates were HORRIBLE (i would say in my top 5 worst i've ever had)....we ended up throwing them away.  the tea was "good".
The best coffee brand In Charlotte.

My Number 1 coffee spot in Charlotte by far! They make all of their own syrups in house and treat everyone as if they are a regular. Their food and cocktail programs are often overlooked because their coffee is so good, but PLEASE DON'T! They genuinely care about their employees and the community...just another reason I choose to support this great company!

This location is a trek for me, so I was excited to finally be in the area and get to try it out on a Saturday and get a bit of work done. Went to the counter to order and there was a sign that says "No laptops, no Wifi on weekends."  I get it. There's a pandemic going on. There's limited seating. But no where on the website, on socials, in the reviews, etc. is it mentioned that laptops are not welcome. And the girl at the counter gave me a bit of an attitude like I should have known better...  Seemed like a cute location and the food looked yummy, but they need to give people a heads up before they arrive. Anyway, I just want to help other people out who may come and have the same disappointing experience. I left and headed to Stable Hand where food is served and laptops are welcome.

So I completely get you need to wear your mask, and that is exactly what I did as I entered into the facility. Once a lady at the register was available to help me, and I was ready to place my order, I slid my mask down to be able to speak, without my glasses fogging up, and to make sure she heard me. She then immediately interrupts me to demand I pull my mask up. I completely get wearing the mask, but the fact there was glass in between us, I just don't understand her rudeness. I WILL NEVER BE BACK!

I have been coming here ever since they opened, and I have always had a stellar experience. They use healthier coffee, and the staff is always friendly.  This place is my go to for coffee and yogurt parfaits.
The coffee was definitively good but hands down expensive. Although we like the place, prices have us looking elsewhere b4 decide coming in.

One of the best local places for coffee! If I am feeling something sweet I opt for the vanilla latte which is excellent. If I have a matcha craving this is my favorite place to grab an unsweetened matcha latte with almond milk. Tons of milk substitute options and I have never had a bad experience.
Prices are a bit steep, but the coffee is great! I wish they had some more food options.
Update your hours of operation if you are going to close unexpectedly
I do like their coffee, but be warned that you are not allowed to use laptops on the weekends, and they lock their WiFi. They may tell you this after you order a coffee and set up shop :(
(Translated by Google) One of the most beautiful cafes, especially the macchiato is dangerous  (Original) ŸÖŸÜ ÿßÿ¨ŸÖŸÑ ÿßŸÑŸÖŸÇÿßŸáŸä ÿ®ÿßŸÑÿ∞ÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿßŸÉŸäÿßÿ™Ÿà ÿÆÿ∑ŸäŸäÿ±Ÿá

Cozy hangout cafe that serves artisanal coffee ‚òïÔ∏è and recently started full food menu and a complete bar. Lots of veggie and GF options, yogurt parfait is amazing nd a must try. Veggie quiche is really yummy too.
LOVE LOVE LOVE the coffee here.
Nice little coffee shop. Cappuccino was delightful as was the staff. Their spirits selection (which I will indulge in next time) was A+.

Even though a coffee stop wasn't planned, as soon as I opened the door and waited in line to place an order I felt the friendly small town vibe that I miss. They're not only a coffee shop, they also have a kitchen and bar. I only tried the chai which was fabulous, coming from a person of Indian origin. Their space is fairly cozy. I did notice a sign at the register stating laptop usage was discouraged during the weekend however, the establishment does foster communication and dialogue as most people where having an actual conversation and not glued to their phones/computer. The chai was great, loved the cups and saucers, staff were friendly. Great ending from a trip to Charlotte.
Fall latte is the best you can find
Loud. Crowded. Overpriced. No thanks!
No lap top policy on weekend is absurd. Have frequented this shop for years and will not return.
Great little coffee shop...I love they brew with Counter Culture Coffee!
Love this location! The coffee is delicious and I love the chai lattes. Convenient stop for a great drink and just a great place to meet with friends. Be sure to check it out!
Great service, friendly and professional staff. Pretty pricey for breakfast. Great coffee, good food.
Not allowing laptops or Wi-Fi on the weekends is a very bizarre policy for a coffee shop. The baristas were friendly and the coffee was good, but the no laptop policy puts a bad taste in one's mouth.
On the pricey side. Good lattes
Best place to grab a cup of coffee in Charlotte.
Excellent avocado toast
Easily my favorite Not Just Coffee location. The coffee selection is well selected and executed. Barry is the best! He knows his drinks but also takes the time to get to know his guests.

Good products, just a bit expensive. I got a drip coffee which was $3+, but then was told it would be an additional charge for a refill on not a large mug. Just felt a bit cheap, even one refill is pretty standard especially if you are charging a premium price. Perhaps they are just trying to stop people from buying a cup of coffee and sitting all day? Tables are also at an odd high to work on and not comfortable. Not a good place to work from, but again that might be by design.
Atmosphere was great, customer service was great, coffee was phenomenal! Try the Nitro Cold Brew for a quick pick me up!!

Hey, just wanted to let you guys know, that THIS coffee shop not only has coffee that DOES'NT wake you up, lol, but their iced lattes are over $7, and they won't even let you request ‚Äúno room,‚Äù like Starbucks or pretty much any other coffee shop in the free world.  They charge you ‚Äúextra‚Äù to top it off with milk. I literally almost got into an argument over this over priced drink with the manger. She refused to put ONE THIRD OF AN OUNCE of milk in the cup, to fill it to the top, and kept insisting that their coffees are ‚Äúmeasured out precisely.‚Äù Get out of here! They won't get my business anymore, and I hope they don't get yours. Coffee doesn't even taste great at that!
Best coffee in Charlotte - hands down. Great people and service too. Consistent across all of their locations.
Amazing coffee, delicious avocado toast, and very approachable staff. Can't wait to go back!
I love their sandwiches!
Great interactive staff!! Coffee is first class and  Bar drinks Amazing!! especially the forbidden fruit on the tiki menu . Make sure you ask for Adrian "Best Barista in town".
Baristas are always friendly and make the most delicious coffee and perfect latte art! Love studying here
My favorite place in Charlotte for coffee and cappuccino and latte etc

I'm not a local, I happen to stop here for an after dinner latte and I was delightfully surprised! The atmosphere was peaceful and beautiful, and the staff was incredibly helpful and sweet. Not to mention the latte I had was perfectly delicious. I highly recommend picking up a bag of the Counter Culture coffee they use!! Great coffee and great experience.
The best caramel latte ever! üòä

People are nice, but we ordered nitro cold brew and it was horrible! It left my husband sick in the stomack and it was so bitter with a strange aftertaste I could only drink 1/4 of it. I really didnt get the nitro. Waste of $5 (each, for small). I've only ever had nitro cold from Hex and that has set a high bar of expectations. So bad I don't think I would go back to try anything else. Shame, because the concept and space are nice.
Terrible laptop policy! Lost my business.
Exceptional coffee the best in town
Great location with pretty people before work.  Counter culture coffee and a full bar for after work.  Small inside space so you'll be sitting intimately work others.  Small covered patio.
My favorite NJC location. Super calm!
Friendly staff, quality espresso/cappucino, nitro cold brew...top notch.

Well, it's Not Just Coffee, so expectations were already high, but the combination of quality service, that pinpoint Charlotte atmosphere only a few places can pull off, and a REALLY unique cocktail menu pushed me to have to leave a stellar review. The fam wanted an energy boost, and I thought I wanted nothing until I saw a serious lineup of good liquors lining their shelves, like "Wait, where am I?" It was phenomenal.

Doubtful I'm the first to experience this: As I entered, noticed there were a few people around, looked like a nice place, I had an obvious laptop bag & power-cord in hand as I ordered a small brewed coffee for $3, smiled and left a $1 tip.  There was no line, chill atmosphere.  Couldn't access the wireless, so came back to the counter; the 2 barista's continued their conversation for what felt like an age, then said they couldn't provide a password to the guess-wireless, because they have a "no laptop policy".  They suggested I go their other location. All was delivered with a courteous expression, but felt quite callus. I didn't notice any signage.

Specials daily. Wonderful coffee. Pure taste. Great atmosphere.  Cozy and homey-feel. Sweet desserts. Bar. Inside and outside seating with ceiling fans. Restroom. Dog friendly. Free Wi-fi. Great customer service. Knowledgeable. Menu's available.
The coffee was awesome! We had hot and cold!
Perfect cup of coffee every time! For those who want just a hint of sweetness with their lattes, I suggest doing a 1/3 caramel latte.
Proper latte and great service

To be fair, I didn't have coffee here. I wanted to get tea but there wasn't much selection. I had their parfait and a waffle. The parfait tasted way weird and they put bean sprouts on it. There were even bean sprouts on my waffle. Chill out with the bean sprouts. Speaking of my waffle, it was burnt to a charred, inedible state. When I saw it I asked the girl at the counter if it was supposed to be that way. She said "Kind of. That's how the waffle maker makes them." Uhh ok. Overall I don't understand why this place has such good ratings. But then again, I'm not a hipster.

I usually get heavy cream in my coffee when I come here, and this time was told that they didn't have it. When referring how I usually get it, I was told that they actually do have it but that they use it for other things and that I shouldn't have been given it. I asked if I could have some today for the coffee since I've already ordered it and she's poured the coffee, and was told flat-out no. Ok, then. Our party of 3 will go somewhere else I said. ‚ÄúThat's fine.‚Äù Very very rude.
Very fresh roasted espresso, delicious!
Great place to work or chat!
Great tasting coffee! I like that they carry decaf espresso and oat milk!
I don't see the hype about this place, the coffee was incredibly bitter

NJC can be the best community working space to grab a coffee and EOB transition that into speciality cocktail. The atmosphere can seem like a quiet oasis while plugged in focused on a task or a melting pot of Charlottes best energy if you need to be inspired. I'm not a coffee drinker, I actually go for the am tea and evening spirits, Nonetheless one of my favorite hideaways in clt!
beautiful store and great coffee but they don't have wifi and have a no laptop policy on weekends. Don't go if you want to work!

Awesome little coffee shop! We will definitely be coming back. The coffee was good and the staff was very friendly. There was lots of seating maybe because it was in a workday but there is plenty! The atmosphere is really cool!

Our favorite new place to squat of a Saturday morning. Barry, the manager, is thoughtful, generous, and a great host. They don't do pour overs here, but no sweat! The drip coffee is of pour over quality thanks to the top notch Fetco brew machines. I've had the same Counter Culture roast served up here and prepared meticulously by a friend/pour-over fanatic at work, with equal satisfaction. Refills only a fraction of the price for a cup means a killer deal on some killer coffee. Great atmosphere, all sorts of other interesting food & (adult) drinks, and adjustable stools (genius) are just more reasons to stop by. Thanks for coming to our neighborhood!
Cocktails!!!!!!
Good coffee, but despite the name not a lot else.  I've visited a few times and they were out of ground coffee.  They do offer beer and wine though if you're looking to balance your buzz.
Great cozy atmosphere and amazing avocado toast with poached egg!
Just like other locations... great, expertly made coffee.

I got the cappuccino  and the lady who made it was so skilled! I wish i knew her name, she measured the espresso perfectly and did such amazing latte art,  on my cappuccino which i am not used to latte art on my cappuccinos, but im not complaining! Also the cheesy bread is sooooo good, but i would recommend sharing it with someone or even 3 or 4 people.
Amazing food, drink and staff
Great coffee, worth waiting

The coffee and roast were terrible, but even worse they did not allow me to work on my iPad claiming a policy about not occupying tables needed for brunch when two students across from me had a spread of textbooks out in front of them, isn't that occupying a table for a long period of time too? Do I smell discrimination?

Iced caramel latte is the best here. This spot also serves some pretty tasty food - breakfast, lunch and I believe a later meal - and the ambiance is nice. I cant get enough of their caramel latte - yes, it's that good.
Great coffee, great food and free wifi. Perfect place to work remote.
A gem of an airy coffee shop nestled within a bustling, off-the- beaten path strip center in Dilworth, with stunning, delicious and creatively-prepared avocado toast
Fall spice latte is beautifully crafted. Not crazy pumpkin and just enough spice to warm the soul.
Best coffee and shop in CLT.
Great coffee. Very cool coffee shop
A cute cafe connected to a high-end clothing store and an art gallery with a nice atmosphere for working in or taking out.

Coffee is made well, food is good (especially avocado toast ü§§) but the ‚Äúno Wi-Fi‚Äù policy on the weekends is a real bummer. I understand no laptops(to preserve space), but no Wi-Fi is unnecessary. The internet is not just for work, and the solo breakfast eater would love to look at Instagram without using data while enjoying breakfast.
Great coffee of course, but also a great bar and well-conceived crafted cocktails.
Amazing staff, coffee, and food! They also have very tasty cocktails as well. The vibe is like no other I have experienced before.
A nice strong espresso to get you started
Great coffee and fun vibe regardless of time of day. The food is fantastic. Best baristas in Charlotte.
Quaint little spot
Great coffee and cool cocktails
Lovely place. Recommended by a friend and damn they have so many varieties of coffee.
Best Coffee in the area plus friendly staff and a cool off the beaten path hangout spot.
Excellent coffee, food, and beverage programs created by some of the best in CLT if not the country. ECCENT Design Build crushed the design and layout of the space
I had the cinnamon toast with strawberries and cappuccino. Everything was excellent. The staff was awesome c as well.
Very good coffee as well as some cool coffee cocktails. A little bit of a small space, which means seating is limited, but very friendly staff and a nice atmosphere.

My favorite Not Just Coffee location. Not only does it live up to the name with a full food and beverage program, but it more than exceeds expectations for a coffee shop/bar hybrid. Wine and food program show a heavy Mediterranean influence. Cocktails are sneaky good - some of the best in the area. And of course, beyond all that, the coffee options are some of the best in Charlotte.
No wifi on weekends. Don't waste your time.
Love the coffee and the great service. The avocado toast is a great breakfast item. Also fun for drinks after evening yoga at yoga one
The scones were incredible as well as the cold brew!

I loved it here! The barista was sweet and helped me find a non-dairy syrup to go with my iced coffee - I ended up having an Iced Oat Latte with Vanilla Sugar Syrup. It was so incredibly delicious! Probably the best iced coffee I've had in Charlotte! We will be back soon!
Great atmosphere! Great coffee and good food choices which was a surprise. Definitely a go to from now on.

Not Just Coffee is my absolute favorite place to go in the mornings. Especially this location. It always has amazing scone choices, drinks are always made consistently, and service is both friendly, thoughtful, and quick. I haven't been disappointed with a food or drink selection, yet. The menu is very impressive!!

This is a very modern little coffee shop and the Barista was super helpful in helping us select our drinks based on our tastes. We were just visiting from out of town and she talked to us about some places to see. The little croissant things they had at the checkout were to die for. The coffee was really rich and strong. The chai latte was very tasty as well. Even though it was sleek and modern, it had a very laid-back vibe. I would definitely recommend.
Good atmosphere, delicious small plates and wonderful coffee

Great service, great coffee, great WiFi, great ambiance and music Good place to get work done in a casual upbeat setting.  Except for on the weekends. I was here on a Sunday, when there were about 5 people total in the entire establishment, and I asked for the WiFi password. Big mistake; as posted on their numerous signs (almost one per table), laptops are not allowed on the weekends. I figured, well, the signs say something about making sure there's room for people having food, but 90% of the tables were deserted so maybe they would be reasonable about the rule posted on the copious signs? I was wrong. When I asked for the WiFi password (after I had bought something, not a big mooch myself), the barista kindly informed me that they "unplugged" the WiFi on the weekends.. I could see the network up, but understood he was saying that because of the no laptop policy and was even kind enough to overlook my laptop being out on a Sunday‚Äìwhen it's prohibited. I went back and kept working looking up what I had to look up on my phone.  I'm not trying to be unreasonable here, if I had been there and it had been busy and I were asked to put my laptop away so someone could sit/share the table I would gladly oblige. Even that would not be the best for building a customer base though. See, another way to see that situation is this, you're telling a paying customer to please stop what they're doing so another customer, who potentially may or may not spend more, can take their spot. Doesn't sound great for customer loyalty. What I do think is unreasonable is to deny yourselves the loyalty and dollars from people that would like come and do some work there, especially when the place is pretty vacant. The signs say it themselves, please avoid being on your laptop during peak times, sure that's reasonable; what's not reasonable is don't be on your laptops on the weekends, even if there's plenty of room.  It's a bummer, because I was really looking forward to making this a go-to, get some coffee, do some work, get some snacks, maybe a meal, some drinks, another coffee. Hope this may be a possibility in the future.

Slow and incompetent service. Gave my food to another customer and only realized it when I inquired if it normally takes 30+ minutes when they only have 4 other tables. When processing refund too busy talking to friends at the bar to focus on refund.  Also on the weekends they have a noI laptop policy which is not posted on their websites this location is confused on what it wants to be when it grows up. Not worth your money

Such a trendy new coffee outfit with not just coffee (!) but so much more! They have cocktails and a food menu as well. The atmosphere is chill - you can go in and have something to eat or drink with a friend, or sit on the patio, or take your laptop in alone and work. It's just a really nice place. What a great addition to Dilworth!
The food, drinks, and coffee are amazing! Also, Nate and Berry are very kind and welcoming.
Amazing cocktails!

Nice coffee chain that offers more than just coffee as the name implies. You can come in for the coffee,  tea or wine as well as their decent selection of food.  The staff here was super friendly.The space was very nice and comfortable if you want to come for a while and do some work.
Great cocktails and tea selection. Haven't tried the coffee.
Good espresso

NJC is my go to  Espresso in Charlotte. Fantastic coffee served precisely the way you order it, with incredible attention to main ingredient, coffee!. Great coffeee, Espresso, oat milk lattes, fantastic! And now with food and brews carrying the day and night through. Love!
